questions.question: According to the Clinical Foundations lesson, which of the following actions would be considered outside the legal scope of practice for a Sleep Health Coach?
options: Providing education on the impact of blue light on melatonin production
Adjusting a client's prescribed CPAP pressure settings based on their sleep data
Using the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI) as a baseline assessment
Recommending environmental changes like blackout curtains and room temperature
questions.explanation: Adjusting medical device settings (like CPAP) is a clinical intervention that must be performed by a licensed respiratory therapist or physician. Coaches focus on behavioral and environmental education.

questions.question: In Niche Mastery, why is the 'Sleep-Deprived Executive' demographic considered a 'High-Value' demographic compared to the general population?
options: They have more leisure time to implement sleep protocols
They have a higher 'Cost of Inaction' (COI) due to the impact of sleep on high-stakes decision making
They are less likely to have pre-existing medical sleep disorders
They prefer group coaching models over one-on-one interventions
questions.explanation: High-value niches are defined by a high Cost of Inaction. For executives, poor sleep can lead to million-dollar mistakes, making the ROI of coaching significantly higher.

questions.question: In the D.R.E.A.M. Sales Funnel framework, what is the primary objective of the 'Relate' (R) stage?
options: To collect payment and sign the coaching agreement
To run technical SEO audits on the coach's website
To demonstrate empathy and validate the client's specific struggle through storytelling or shared data
To provide a 50-page technical manual on sleep architecture
questions.explanation: The Relate stage is about building trust and rapport by showing the prospect that you understand their specific pain points and have helped others in similar situations.

questions.question: A Sleep Coach transition from 1-on-1 coaching to a 'Hybrid Membership' model. According to Lesson 4, what is the primary benefit of this Strategic Revenue Model?
options: It requires more hours of labor per client
It lowers the barrier to entry while increasing the coach's 'Earnings Per Hour' (EPH) through one-to-many delivery
It eliminates the need for any client interaction
It is only effective for infant sleep niches
questions.explanation: Hybrid models allow coaches to serve more people simultaneously, decoupling their income from 1:1 time and increasing their effective hourly rate.

questions.question: When applying SEO strategies for a sleep practice (Lesson 5), what does the 'Authority' component of Google's E-E-A-T guidelines specifically look for?
options: The number of images on a blog post
The speed at which the website loads on a mobile device
Backlinks and citations from reputable health organizations, medical journals, or established industry peers
The use of high-contrast colors in the website design
questions.explanation: Authority is established when other reputable sources in the health and wellness space link to or cite your content as a reliable source of information.

questions.question: According to the 'Referral Engine' lesson, what is the 'Golden Rule' of partnering with medical professionals?
options: Always offer a 20% cash kickback for every patient they refer
Provide a 'Closing the Loop' report back to the referring physician regarding the client's behavioral progress
Avoid sending any documentation to the physician to protect client privacy
Only partner with professionals who have fewer than 5 years of experience
questions.explanation: Physicians value 'closing the loop.' Providing a brief report on the behavioral outcomes helps the MD see the value of your coaching and ensures better coordinated care.

questions.question: A coach tracks their 'Churn Rate' and finds that out of 40 active monthly clients, 2 cancelled this month. What is their monthly churn rate?
questions.explanation: Churn Rate is calculated as (Cancellations / Total Clients) x 100. (2 / 40) = 0.05, or 5%.

questions.question: What is a key characteristic of 'Operational Excellence' (Lesson 7) in a scaling sleep practice?
options: Manually emailing every client a reminder every morning
Using automated 'Success Triggers' in a CRM to alert the coach when a client hasn't logged sleep data for 3 days
Avoiding the use of contracts to make the process feel more friendly
Storing all client health data in a public Google Sheet for easy access
questions.explanation: Systems for client success and retention involve automation that flags potential issues (like non-compliance) so the coach can intervene proactively.

questions.question: As a 'Master Practitioner' building a Sleep Consultancy (Lesson 8), your primary client shifts from the 'Individual' to the:
options: Local pharmacy
Organization or Corporation (B2B)
Social media influencer
Health insurance adjuster
questions.explanation: Scaling to a consultancy usually involves B2B models where you consult for organizations on workforce sleep health, productivity, and safety policies.

questions.question: Which of the following is a mandatory ethical requirement for a Sleep Health Coach's digital infrastructure?
options: A website that features at least 50 blog posts
A HIPAA-compliant (or GDPR-compliant) platform for storing sensitive client health intake forms
An automated system that posts to Instagram three times daily
A YouTube channel with at least 1,000 subscribers
questions.explanation: Legal and ethical practice setup requires secure, compliant storage of client data. In the US, this typically means using HIPAA-compliant software for any health-related information.
